member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.EDLFile
member.summary:
This class provides a representation of an OpenWay meter EDL file. EDL stands for End Device Language and the file is essentially an XML file that defines the current state of a meter. The EDL format is defined by the ANSI C12.19 format.
This class does NOT provide a complete representation of a EDL file. It provides read-only access to some of the data contained in the file, and it is intended to be used as means to validate meter operation. The class should be extended as needed to expose different data types.

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileDataSource
member.summary: This class represents a single load profile object that will be used in another operation. Note that this class differs from the normal load profile data class in that it contains properties to fully describe the data source as well as the data itself.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileDataSource.#ctor(Itron.Metering.Datafiles.HHFFile)
member.summary: A load profile contributor starts with a data source. In this case the data source in an HHF file. Therefore, in order to construct a new contributor object you must pass in an HHF file object. Note that it could be either a MIF file or an MV-90 HHF file.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileDataSource.FileName
member.summary: This property represents the full path name of the data source

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileDataSource.UnitID
member.summary: This property represents the unit id of the data source

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileDataSource.LPData
member.summary: The property returns the load profile data from the contributor

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileDataSource.ProfileStartTime
member.summary: This property returns the date/time of the first load profile found in the contributor. Note that if no load profile data is available, the system's minimum date/time will be returned

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileDataSource.ProfileEndTime
member.summary: This property returns the date/time of the last load profile found in the contributor. Note that if no load profile data is available, the system's minimum date/time will be returned

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileDataSource.IntervalLength
member.summary: This property returns the length of each load profie interval. If no load profile data is available, a value of 0 will be returned

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileDataSource.NumProfileChannels
member.summary: This property returns the number of load profile channels defined by this contributor. If no load profile data is available, a value of 0 will be returned

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileDataSource.DSTEnabled
member.summary: This property indicates whether or not the load profile data from this contributor follows daylight savings time or not. If no load profile data is available, the property will return a value of false

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileDataSource.ReadTime
member.summary: This property returns the date/time that the load profile data was created and/or read from the device.

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection
member.summary: This class represents a collection of load profile objects (contributors) that are to be acted on as a unit. In other words, the contributors are operands for operations such as totalization and aggregation

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.AddContributor(System.String)
member.summary: This method adds the given file to the contributor list. In doing so, the file will be opened and the load profile data will be extracted. Note that the file should not remain open.
member.returns: A value of true is returned if the data could be successfully read from contributing file. A value of false is returned if no load profile data is present

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.IntervalLength
member.summary: This property returns the common interval length of all contributing data files. If any two contributors do not have the use the same load profile interval length, then a value of 0 is returned.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.NumProfileChannels
member.summary: This property returns the number of load profile channels shared by all contributors. In other words - it is the least common denominator of all of the contributors

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.ProfileStartTime
member.summary: This property represents the effective load profile start time of the contributor list. Note that the exact meaning of the profile start time will be different for each of the derived classes. For example, when totalizing data, the profile start time will be the least common start time of all of the data sources yet, when joining data files, the start time will be the earliest start time of all of the data sources

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.ProfileEndTime
member.summary: This property represents the effective load profile end time of the contributor list. Note that the exact meaning of the profile end time will be different for each of the derived classes. For example, when totalizing data, the profile end time will be the greatest common end time of all of the data sources yet, when joining data files, the end time will be the last available interval found in all of the data sources

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.LPData
member.summary: The property returns the combined load profile data from all valid contributors. This property is an abstract property so that the derived classes can insert unique logic to calculate and/or manipulate the load profile data sources to produce a single load profile data object.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.DataSources
member.summary: This property provides access to the list of contributors that comprise this collection of load profile data. Note that callers should NOT attempt to add or delete data sources directly from the data source list.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.DSTEnabled
member.summary: This property indicates if all of the contributors follow DST or not. Note that this method assumes that all of the contributors use identical DST configurations

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.FindIntervalIndex(Itron.Metering.DeviceDataTypes.LoadProfileData,System.DateTime)
member.summary: This method returns the index of the load profile interval that ends on the given date/time. If the given contributor does not contain profile data for the given date/time, then a value of -1 will be returned

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.VerifyDSTConsistency
member.summary: This method returns true if every contributor in the list shares the same DST setting or false if one or more differences are found

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.VerifyChannelConsistency
member.summary: This method returns true if every contributor in the list shares the same channel definitions or false if one or more differences are found

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.VerifyChannelCount
member.summary: This method returns true if every contributor in the list shares the same number of load profile channels or false if differences are found

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.FlushCachedValues
member.summary: This help method clears all of the cached values in the data source collection. This method should be called whenever the contents of the collection changes.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.CalculateProfileStartTime
member.summary: This method will return the effective profile end date for the derived collection. Note that the exact meaning of the profile start time will be different for each of the derived classes. For example, when totalizing data, the profile start time will be the least common start time of all of the data sources yet, when joining data files, the start time will be the earliest start time of all of the data sources

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.CalculateProfileEndTime
member.summary: This method will return the effective profile end date for the derived collection. Note that the exact meaning of the profile end time will be different for each of the derived classes. For example, when totalizing data, the profile end time will be the greatest common end time of all of the data sources yet, when joining data files, the end time will be the last available interval found in all of the data sources

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.m_lstDataSources
member.summary: The internal list of contributing objects

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.m_nIntervalLength
member.summary: This member holds the interval length common to all members of the load profile collection

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.m_nNumProfileChannels
member.summary: This cached member holds the number of profile channels that all members of the load profile collection currently contain.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.m_dtProfileStartTime
member.summary: This cached member maintains the effective start date of the load profile collection. This value is cached so that it does not have to be calculated each time it is accessed.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Datafiles.LoadProfileCollection.m_dtProfileEndTime

member.summary: This constructor should only be used when creating a new MV-90 file. It cannot be used to read existing files. Note that the file will be created and written during the construction of the object. Although no further actions need to be take to write the data, the file should be closed by the calling application rather than waiting for the garbage collector to release the file handle.
member.param: The full path name of the file to be created
The meter's unit ID to be written to the HHF file
The load profile data to be written to the file
